clean up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to make a place completely clean and tidy
clean up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: We spent all Saturday morning cleaning up.
plans to clean up the beaches
John always expects other people to clean up after him  (=to make a place clean after he has used it).
clean up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to wash yourself after you have got very dirty
clean up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Let me just go clean myself up.
clean up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to start behaving sensibly and responsibly
clean up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Some companies could face heavy fines if they fail to clean up their act.
clean up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to win a lot of money or make a lot of money in a business deal
clean up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: He cleaned up at the races yesterday.
clean up.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to improve moral standards in a place or organization
clean up.translation[0].definitions[4].e: It’s high time British soccer cleaned up its image.
clean up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a process by which you get rid of dirt or waste from a place
clean up.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The cleanup of the oil spill took months.
millions of dollars in clean-up costs
clean up.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to improve an organization by removing parts or people that are not making money or are not effective or honest
clean up.translation[2].definitions[0].e: The company is cleaning up its income statement and developing a more profitable business.
clean up.translation[2].definitions[1].d: to make a lot of money in a deal
clean up.translation[2].definitions[1].e: The traders buying the bonds cleaned up, because they carried high fixed interest rates when inflation was falling quickly.
clean up.translation[3].definitions[0].d: when an organization is improved by removing parts or people that are not making money or are not effective or honest
clean up.translation[3].definitions[0].e: A clean-up may require financial help from the World Bank.
